description: Atom snippets for a variety of icon fonts
name: icon-fonts
readme: # atom-icon-fonts [![apm](https://img.shields.io/apm/l/icon-fonts.svg?style=flat-square)](https://atom.io/packages/icon-fonts) [![apm](https://img.shields.io/apm/v/icon-fonts.svg?style=flat-square)](https://atom.io/packages/icon-fonts) [![apm](https://img.shields.io/apm/dm/icon-fonts.svg?style=flat-square)](https://atom.io/packages/icon-fonts) [![Travis](https://img.shields.io/travis/idleberg/atom-icon-fonts.svg?style=flat-square)](https://travis-ci.org/idleberg/atom-icon-fonts) [![David](https://img.shields.io/david/dev/idleberg/atom-icon-fonts.svg?style=flat-square)](https://david-dm.org/idleberg/atom-icon-fonts?type=dev) **Note:** *As of v2.17, this package supports all __Font Awesome v5__ icons. If you need to continue the old __Font Awesome v4__ icons, please install the* [`icon-fonts-legacy`](https://github.com/idleberg/atom-icon-fonts-legacy) *package via `apm`!* Atom snippets for a variety of icon fonts ([see details](https://github.com/idleberg/atom-icon-fonts#prefixes)). This package is also available for [Sublime Text](https://github.com/idleberg/sublime-icon-fonts) and [Visual Studio Code](https://github.com/idleberg/vscode-icon-fonts). ## Installation ### apm * Install package `apm install icon-fonts` (or use the GUI) ### Using Git 1. Change directory `cd ~/.atom/packages/` 2. Clone repository `git clone https://github.com/idleberg/atom-icon-fonts icon-fonts` ## Usage Snippets are limited to the `.text.html`, `source.(css|less|sass|scss|stylus)` and `.source.js.jsx` scopes. Typing the class name of an icon using the designated prefix will complete to a tag containing the icon class. Exceptions are `fa-layers`, `fa-layers-counter`, `fa-layers-text` and `fa-layers` (``). ### Prefixes Prefix | Icon Font | Version | cdnjs | jsDelivr ------------------|-----------------------------------------|---------|-------|--------- `ai` | [Android Icons][ai] | 1.0.0 | ðŸš« | ðŸš« `cc` | [Creative Commons Icon Font][cc] | 1.2.1 | âœ… | âœ… `bx` | [BoxIcons][bx] | - | ðŸš« | ðŸš« `dashicons` | [WordPress Dashicons][dashicons] | â€“ | ðŸš« | ðŸš« `devicons` | [Devicons][devicons] | 1.8.0 | âœ… | âœ… `el` | [Elusive Icons][el] | 2.0.0 | ðŸš« | ðŸš« `fas`,`far`,`fab` | [Font Awesome Pro][fa] | 5.2.0 | âœ… | âœ… `fi` | [Foundation Icons][fi] | 3.0 | âœ… | âœ… `fl` | [Font Logos][fl] | 0.11 | ðŸš« | ðŸš« `geomicon` | [Geomicons Open][geomicon] | 2.0.0 | ðŸš« | âœ… `glyphicon` | [Bootstrap Glyphicons][glyphicon] | 3.3.7 | ðŸš« | ðŸš« `icono` | [Icono][icono] | 1.3.0 | âœ… | ðŸš« `ion` | [Ionicons][ion] | 2.0.1 | ðŸš« | ðŸš« `mdi` | [Material Design Icons][mdi] | 2.4.85 | âœ… | ðŸš« `mfg` | [MFG Labs Iconset][mfg] | â€“ | ðŸš« | ðŸš« `mfizz` | [Font Mfizz][mfizz] | 2.4.1 | âœ… | ðŸš« `mio` | [Material Design Icons (Official)][mio] | 3.0.1 | ðŸš« | ðŸš« `octicon` | [GitHub Octicons][octicon] | 4.1.0 | ðŸš« | ðŸš« `oi` | [Open Iconic][oi] | 1.1.0 | ðŸš« | âœ… `openwebicons` | [OpenWeb Icons][openwebicons] | 1.4.3 | âœ… | âœ… `pf` | [PaymentFont][pf] | 1.2.5 | âœ… | ðŸš« `ratchicon` | [Ratchicons][ratchicon] | 2.0.2 | âœ… | âœ… `st` | [Stack Icons][st] | 1.0.0 | ðŸš« | ðŸš« `typcn` | [Typicons][typcn] | 2.0.7 | ðŸš« | ðŸš« `wi` | [Weather Icons][wi] | 2.0.10 | âœ… | ðŸš« `zmdi` | [Material Design Iconic Font][zmdi] | 2.2.0 | âœ… | ðŸš« Several previously supported fonts have been removed and are now available in the [SVG icons](https://github.com/idleberg/atom-svg-icons) package or the icon fonts [legacy package](https://github.com/idleberg/atom-icon-fonts-legacy). Examples: * `fa-check`+Tab completes to `` * `glyphicon-check`+Tab completes to `` * well, you get the idea ### CDNs If a supported CDN is indicated in the [table](#prefixes) above, you can use the prefixes `cdnjs` or `jsdelivr` to quickly insert a link to the CDN-hosted asset: Examples: * `cdnjs-fa`+Tab completes to a `` tag to the Font Awesome style-sheet * `jsdelivr-fa`+Tab completes to a `` tag to the Font Awesome style-sheet * `jsdelivr-geomicon`+Tab completes to a `
